sentence.text: Drug Label for drug brand Tracleer, containing bosentan.

mmtx.phraseText: Drug Label for drug brand Tracleer,
Drug Label for drug brand Tracleer,

sentence.text: T.A.P. is a component of the Tracleer Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy (REMS).

mmtx.phraseText: a component of the Tracleer Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy (REMS).

sentence.text: This case reinforces the importance of strict adherence to the monthly monitoring schedule for the duration of treatment and the treatment algorithm, which includes stopping Tracleer with a rise of aminotransferases accompanied by signs or symptoms of liver dysfunction see Dosage and Administration (2.2).

mmtx.phraseText: stopping Tracleer with a rise of aminotransferases
stopping Tracleer with a rise of aminotransferases

sentence.text: Throughout treatment and for one month after stopping Tracleer, females of childbearing potential must use two reliable methods of contraception unless the patient has a tubal sterilization or Copper T 380A IUD or LNg 20 IUS inserted, in which case no other contraception is needed.

Hormonal contraceptives, including oral, injectable, transdermal, and implantable contraceptives should not be used as the sole means of contraception because these may not be effective in patients receiving Tracleer see Drug Interactions (7.2).
<item>To prevent pregnancy, females of childbearing potential must use two reliable forms of contraception during treatment and for one month after stopping Tracleer (4.1, 8.1).
<item>Use with Cyclosporine A (4.2)
<item>Use with Glyburide (4.3)

To prevent pregnancy, females of childbearing potential must use two reliable forms of contraception during treatment and for one month after stopping Tracleer. see Boxed Warning, Warnings and Precautions (5.2), Drug Interactions (7.2), Use in Specific Populations (8.1).
Coadministration of cyclosporine A and bosentan resulted in markedly increased plasma concentrations of bosentan.

mmtx.phraseText: resulted in markedly increased plasma concentrations of bosentan.
resulted in markedly increased plasma concentrations of bosentan.

sentence.text: Therefore, concomitant use of Tracleer and cyclosporine A is contraindicated see Drug Interactions (7.3).
An increased risk of liver enzyme elevations was observed in patients receiving glyburide concomitantly with bosentan.
Therefore coadministration of glyburide and Tracleer is contraindicated see Drug Interactions (7.4).
Tracleer is contraindicated in patients who are hypersensitive to bosentan or any component of the product.
Peripheral edema is a known clinical consequence of PAH and worsening PAH and is also a known effect of Tracleer and other endothelin receptor antagonists.
Preclinical data also suggest that Tracleer, like other endothelin receptor antagonists, may have an adverse effect on spermatogenesis see Adverse Reactions (6.1), Nonclinical Toxicology (13.1).
<item>Hormonal contraceptives: Tracleer use decreases contraceptive exposure and reduces effectiveness (7.2).
<item>Simvastatin and other CYP3A-metabolized statins: Combination use decreases statin exposure and may reduce efficacy (7.6).

ellipsisSentence.text: <item>Hormonal contraceptives: Tracleer use decreases contraceptive exposure and reduces effectiveness (7.2).
<item>Hormonal contraceptives: Tracleer use decreases contraceptive exposure and reduces effectiveness (7.2).

sentence.text: <item>Rifampin: Alters bosentan exposure.
Monitor hepatic function weekly for 4 weeks, followed by normal monitoring (7.7).
Inhibition of these enzymes may increase the plasma concentration of bosentan (see ketoconazole).

Concomitant administration of both a CYP2C9 inhibitor (such as fluconazole or amiodarone) and a strong CYP3A inhibitor (e.g., ketoconazole, itraconazole) or a moderate CYP3A inhibitor (e.g., amprenavir, erythromycin, fluconazole, diltiazem) with Tracleer will likely lead to large increases in plasma concentrations of bosentan.
Coadministration of such combinations of a CYP2C9 inhibitor plus a strong or moderate CYP3A inhibitor with Tracleer is not recommended.
Consequently plasma concentrations of drugs metabolized by these two isozymes will be decreased when Tracleer is coadministered.

antecedentSentence.Text: Bosentan is an inducer of CYP3A and CYP2C9.

entity.text: drugs metabolized by these two isozymes

sentence.text: Hormonal contraceptives, including oral, injectable, transdermal, and implantable forms, may not be reliable when Tracleer is coadministered.
Females should practice additional methods of contraception and not rely on hormonal contraception alone when taking Tracleer see Boxed Warning, Contraindications (4.1).

An interaction study demonstrated that coadministration of bosentan and a combination oral hormonal contraceptive produced average decreases of norethindrone and ethinyl estradiol levels of 14% and 31%, respectively.

mmtx.phraseText: a combination oral hormonal contraceptive produced average decreases of norethindrone
a combination oral hormonal contraceptive produced average decreases of norethindrone

sentence.text: However, decreases in exposure were as much as 56% and 66%, respectively, in individual subjects.

ellipsisSentence.text: An interaction study demonstrated that coadministration of bosentan and a combination oral hormonal contraceptive produced average decreases of norethindrone and ethinyl estradiol levels of 14% and 31%, respectively.

An interaction study demonstrated that coadministration of bosentan and a combination oral hormonal contraceptive produced average decreases of norethindrone and ethinyl estradiol levels of 14% and 31%, respectively.

An interaction study demonstrated that coadministration of bosentan and a combination oral hormonal contraceptive produced average decreases of norethindrone and ethinyl estradiol levels of 14% and 31%, respectively.

sentence.text: The concomitant administration of Tracleer and cyclosporine A is contraindicated see Contraindications (4.2).
During the first day of concomitant administration, trough concentrations of bosentan were increased by about 30-fold.

ellipsisSentence.text: The concomitant administration of Tracleer and cyclosporine A is contraindicated see Contraindications (4.2).

sentence.text: The mechanism of this interaction is most likely inhibition of transport protein-mediated uptake of bosentan into hepatocytes by cyclosporine.

mmtx.phraseText: most likely inhibition of transport protein-mediated uptake of bosentan
most likely inhibition of transport protein-mediated uptake of bosentan

sentence.text: Steady-state bosentan plasma concentrations were 3- to 4-fold higher than in the absence of cyclosporine A.
Coadministration of bosentan decreased the plasma concentrations of cyclosporine A (a CYP3A substrate) by approximately 50%.

mmtx.phraseText: the plasma concentrations of cyclosporine A
the plasma concentrations of cyclosporine A

sentence.text: An increased risk of elevated liver aminotransferases was observed in patients receiving concomitant therapy with glyburide.

ellipsisSentence.text: Coadministration of bosentan decreased the plasma concentrations of cyclosporine A (a CYP3A substrate) by approximately 50%.

sentence.text: Therefore, the concomitant administration of Tracleer and glyburide is contraindicated, and alternative hypoglycemic agents should be considered see Contraindications (4.3).
Coadministration of bosentan decreased the plasma concentrations of glyburide by approximately 40%.
The plasma concentrations of bosentan were also decreased by approximately 30%.

ellipsisSentence.text: Coadministration of bosentan decreased the plasma concentrations of glyburide by approximately 40%.

sentence.text: Tracleer is also expected to reduce plasma concentrations of other oral hypoglycemic agents that are predominantly metabolized by CYP2C9 or CYP3A.

entity.text: oral hypoglycemic agents that are predominantly metabolized by CYP2C9 or CYP3A

mmtx.phraseText: plasma concentrations of other oral hypoglycemic agents
plasma concentrations of other oral hypoglycemic agents

sentence.text: The possibility of worsened glucose control in patients using these agents should be considered.

ellipsisSentence.text: Tracleer is also expected to reduce plasma concentrations of other oral hypoglycemic agents that are predominantly metabolized by CYP2C9 or CYP3A.
Tracleer is also expected to reduce plasma concentrations of other oral hypoglycemic agents that are predominantly metabolized by CYP2C9 or CYP3A.

sentence.text: 7.5 Lopinavir/Ritonavir or Other Ritonavir-containing HIV Regimens
However, the impact of ritonavir on the pharmacokinetics of bosentan may largely result from its effect on OATP.

In normal volunteers, coadministration of Tracleer 125 mg twice daily and lopinavir/ritonavir 400/100 mg twice daily increased the trough concentrations of bosentan on Days 4 and 10 approximately 48-fold and 5-fold, respectively, compared with those measured after Tracleer administered alone.

mmtx.phraseText: coadministration of Tracleer 125 mg twice daily

sentence.text: Therefore, adjust the dose of Tracleer when initiating lopinavir/ritonavir see Dosage and Administration (2.4.
Coadministration of bosentan 125 mg twice daily had no substantial impact on the pharmacokinetics of lopinavir/ritonavir 400/100 mg twice daily.

mmtx.phraseText: Coadministration of bosentan 125 mg twice daily

sentence.text: 7.6 Simvastatin and Other Statins
Coadministration of bosentan decreased the plasma concentrations of simvastatin (a CYP3A substrate), and its active -hydroxy acid metabolite, by approximately 50%.
Tracleer is also expected to reduce plasma concentrations of other statins that are significantly metabolized by CYP3A, such as lovastatin and atorvastatin.

entity.text: statins that are significantly metabolized by CYP3A

sentence.text: The possibility of reduced statin efficacy should be considered.

antecedentSentence.Text: Tracleer is also expected to reduce plasma concentrations of other statins that are significantly metabolized by CYP3A, such as lovastatin and atorvastatin.

antecedentEntity.text: statins that are significantly metabolized by CYP3A

ellipsisSentence.text: Tracleer is also expected to reduce plasma concentrations of other statins that are significantly metabolized by CYP3A, such as lovastatin and atorvastatin.

sentence.text: Patients using CYP3A-metabolized statins should have cholesterol levels monitored after Tracleer is initiated to see whether the statin dose needs adjustment.

Coadministration of bosentan and rifampin in normal volunteers resulted in a mean 6-fold increase in bosentan trough levels after the first concomitant dose (likely due to inhibition of OATP by rifampin), but about a 60% decrease in bosentan levels at steady-state.
The effect of Tracleer on rifampin levels has not been assessed.
When consideration of the potential benefits, and known and unknown risks leads to concomitant use, measure serum aminotransferases weekly for the first 4 weeks before reverting to normal monitoring.

ellipsisSentence.text: The effect of Tracleer on rifampin levels has not been assessed.
The effect of Tracleer on rifampin levels has not been assessed.

sentence.text: Coadministration of tacrolimus and Tracleer has not been studied in humans.
Coadministration of tacrolimus and bosentan resulted in markedly increased plasma concentrations of bosentan in animals.

mmtx.phraseText: resulted in markedly increased plasma concentrations of bosentan
resulted in markedly increased plasma concentrations of bosentan

sentence.text: Caution should be exercised if tacrolimus and Tracleer are used together.
Coadministration of bosentan 125 mg twice daily and ketoconazole, a potent CYP3A inhibitor, increased the plasma concentrations of bosentan by approximately 2-fold in normal volunteers.
No dose adjustment of Tracleer is necessary, but increased effects of Tracleer should be considered.

ellipsisSentence.text: Coadministration of bosentan 125 mg twice daily and ketoconazole, a potent CYP3A inhibitor, increased the plasma concentrations of bosentan by approximately 2-fold in normal volunteers.

sentence.text: Coadministration of bosentan 500 mg twice daily for 6 days in normal volunteers decreased the plasma concentrations of both S-warfarin (a CYP2C9 substrate) and R-warfarin (a CYP3A substrate) by 29 and 38%, respectively.

mmtx.phraseText: Coadministration of bosentan 500 mg twice daily

sentence.text: Clinical experience with concomitant administration of Tracleer and warfarin in patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension did not show clinically relevant changes in INR or warfarin dose (baseline vs. end of the clinical studies), and the need to change the warfarin dose during the trials due to changes in INR or due to adverse events was similar among Tracleer- and placebo-treated patients.

mmtx.phraseText: the warfarin dose during the trials
Clinical experience with concomitant administration of Tracleer

sentence.text: 7.11 Digoxin, Nimodipine, and Losartan
Bosentan has no significant pharmacokinetic interactions with digoxin and nimodipine, and losartan has no significant effect on plasma levels of bosentan.

mmtx.phraseText: no significant effect on plasma levels of bosentan.
no significant pharmacokinetic interactions with digoxin

sentence.text: In normal volunteers, coadministration of multiple doses of 125 mg twice daily bosentan and 80 mg three times daily sildenafil resulted in a reduction of sildenafil plasma concentrations by 63% and increased bosentan plasma concentrations by 50%.

mmtx.phraseText: resulted in a reduction of sildenafil plasma concentrations
resulted in a reduction of sildenafil plasma concentrations
coadministration of multiple doses of 125 mg twice daily bosentan

sentence.text: In a small, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study, 34 patients treated with bosentan 125 mg twice daily for at least 16 weeks tolerated the addition of inhaled iloprost (up to 5 mcg 6 to 9 times per day during waking hours).

mmtx.phraseText: treated with bosentan 125 mg twice daily
